jobs.title: Senior Optical Engineer
jobs.description:
CoMind is building non-invasive brain-computer interfaces focused on dramatically increasing our understanding of the brain and changing how we interact with computers.

CoMind is looking for an experienced Senior Optical Engineer who has hands-on experience working with medical equipment or consumer electronics or other relevant hardware experience. You will design lenses and use optical technologies to improve brain imaging technologies. You will be working in a rapidly growing team to build technology which will change how humans interact with technology. You will also be working alongside Electrical Engineers, Mechanical Engineers and Neuroscientists to create a new form of neuroimaging. You must have experience with infrared sensors and light sources and be adaptable and ready to learn.

CoMind is a venture-backed start-up including some of the top investors in Europe.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
 
The role will offer the candidate a unique opportunity to acquire new skills and develop their own creative solutions in an experimental environment. We are looking for creative thinkers, who are experienced in leading teams, and who welcome new challenges and solve problems with a fresh and unique perspective. You never shy away from and enjoy solving difficult problems and helping others to solve difficult problems.
 
You should have a thorough understanding of hardware engineering, optical engineering or optical imaging. You must have experience leading a team larger than 20 engineers and have hired more than 5 candidates into those roles.
 
You should be able to effectively lead a diverse and multidisciplinary team of engineers and physicists. You should be able to effectively communicate your needs, concepts, and ideas to the rest of the team to enable them to transform these into designs and systems. You should have an entrepreneurial mindset and a very strong work ethic. You are a fast learner and adaptable to different problems even if you don’t have as much experience in that area.
 
You want to make the world a better place and build tools to enhance our understanding of the brain. 

 
YOU SHOULD APPLY IF YOU HAVE: 
 
M.S. or PhD in Physics, Optical Engineering, or other relevant fields or experience within the industry.
3+ years of optical engineering experience.
1+ years of practical (not just research) experience designing, deploying, testing, and reliability hardening optical systems.
Fluent scientific programming in Matlab, Python or C++ or equivalent.
Experience testing and designing DFB and VCSEL laser diodes.
Experience working with external partners for prototyping and manufacturing of lenses or other optical elements.
Proof of exceptional ability in optical engineering or a similar field.
Highly creative first principle thinker who thrives on hard problems and is a natural people person and leader.
 
 
ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS:
 
Experience with optical spectroscopy, optical imaging, such as microscopes and telescopes. 
3+ years of experience using and designing optoelectronic devices.
3+ years of experience with Zemax and Comsol.
1+ years of experience with mechanical and thermal computational modeling 
1+ examples of patent authorship and invention disclosures.
3+ years of experience using avalanche photodiodes, single photon detector and avalanche photodiode arrays.
Experience in Electrical Engineering.
Personal projects and an extensive portfolio of relevant work done in your own time.
Excellent documentation and communication skills.
Multiple publications in the field.
 
WHAT WE OFFER:
 
Competitive salary plus stock options. 
An opportunity to change how humans interact with computers and the potential to save lives. 
The chance to help grow a company and its culture from the ground up. 
A promising career growth opportunity. We would much rather promote people who have exceeded expectations in their current role rather than hire new people. 
Lunch, breakfast and snacks provided.

jobs.title: VP of Hardware Engineering
jobs.description:
CoMind is building non-invasive brain-computer interfaces focused on dramatically increasing our understanding of the brain and changing how we interact with computers.

CoMind is looking for a VP of Hardware Engineering who has hands-on experience working with medical equipment, consumer electronics or other relevant hardware experience. You will design lenses and use optical technologies to improve brain imaging technologies. You will be working in a rapidly growing team to build technology which will change how humans interact with technology. You will be leading a team of Electrical Engineers, Neuroscientists and Optical Engineers to create a new form of neuroimaging. You must have previous experience leading engineering teams and must have experience working in either optical engineering, electrical engineering, neuroimaging or hardware engineering.

CoMind is a venture-backed start-up including some of the top investors in Europe.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
 
The role will offer you a unique opportunity to acquire new skills and develop your own creative solutions in an experimental environment. We are looking for creative thinkers, who are experienced in leading teams, and who welcome new challenges and solve problems with a fresh and unique perspective. You never shy away from and enjoy solving difficult problems and helping others to solve difficult problems.
 
You should have a thorough understanding of hardware engineering, optical engineering or optical imaging. You must have experience leading teams of over 20 engineers and have hired more than 5 candidates into those roles.
 
You should be able to effectively lead a diverse and multidisciplinary team of engineers and physicists. You should be able to effectively communicate your needs, concepts, and ideas to the rest of the team to enable them to transform these into designs and systems. You should have an entrepreneurial mindset and a very strong work ethic. You must be a fast learner and adaptable to different problems even if you don’t have as much experience in that area.
 


YOU SHOULD APPLY IF YOU HAVE: 
 
M.S. or PhD in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, or other relevant fields or experience within the industry.
5+ years of experience within industry building hardware products either specified in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering or Research.
2+ years in academic research or other relevant research.
2+ years in an Engineering Management/CTO/VP role, managing teams of greater than 20 engineers.
Ideally, experience working in a fast-paced start-up type environment from early stage.
Track record of attracting and hiring phenomenal engineers into roles such as electrical engineers or optical engineers.
Fluent scientific programming in Matlab, Python or C++ or equivalent.
Experience building and designing optical imaging hardware, consumer optics, medical imaging or neuroimaging devices (Ideally fNIRS or DOT).
Experience using Ultrasound transducers and relevant technologies.
Experience working with external partners for prototyping and manufacturing of lenses or other optical elements.
Experience conducting research experiments.
Proof of exceptional ability in optical engineering, electrical engineering or a similar field.
Highly creative first principle thinker who thrives on hard problems and is a natural people person and leader.
Experience leading a team, creating plans, forecasting and assigning workload and resources.
You want to make the world a better place and build tools to enhance our understanding of the brain. 
 
 
ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS:
 
Experience building and designing optical spectroscopy, optical imaging, such as microscopes and telescopes. 
3+ years of experience using and designing optoelectronic devices.
5+ examples of patent authorship and invention disclosures or relevant academic research papers in a relevant field.
1+ years of experience using avalanche photodiodes, single photon detector and avalanche photodiode arrays and experience testing and designing DFB and VCSEL laser diodes.
1+ years of experience in Electrical Engineering.
Personal projects and an extensive portfolio of relevant work done in your own time.
Excellent documentation and communication skills.
 
WHAT WE OFFER:
 
Competitive salary plus stock options. 
An opportunity to change how humans interact with computers and the potential to save lives. 
The chance to help grow a company and its culture from the ground up. 
A promising career growth opportunity. We would much rather promote people who have exceeded expectations in their current role rather than hire new people. 
Lunch, breakfast and snacks provided.
